name: Paneer Kulcha
history: Paneer Kulcha is a variation of the classic kulcha, a type of leavened flatbread that originated in the Indian subcontinent. It combines the soft texture of kulcha with a delicious stuffing of spiced paneer, making it a popular choice in Indian cuisine.
description: Paneer Kulcha is a stuffed flatbread made with a soft dough and filled with a flavorful mixture of paneer (Indian cottage cheese), herbs, and spices. It is usually baked or cooked on a tawa (griddle) and often served with chutney or curry.

ingredients.item: spices (garam masala, cumin powder, red chili powder)

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, yeast or baking powder, sugar, and salt. Add yogurt and warm water to form a soft dough. Knead well, then add oil and knead again. Cover and let it rest for about 2 hours until the dough rises.

instructions.title: Make Paneer Filling
instructions.description: Mix crumbled paneer, onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, and spices in a bowl. Adjust salt and spices to taste.

instructions.title: Stuff and Roll the Kulchas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a small circle, place some paneer filling in the center, and seal it. Roll it again into a flat circular shape.

instructions.title: Cook the Kulchas
instructions.description: Heat a tawa or griddle. Place the rolled kulcha on it and cook until brown spots appear on both sides. Optionally, brush with butter or ghee.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve hot Paneer Kulchas with chutney or curry of your choice.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for the best texture.
You can adjust the filling ingredients according to your preference.
variations: Add grated vegetables to the paneer filling for a nutritious twist.
Experiment with different spices in the dough for varied flavors.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored for up to 1 day in the refrigerator.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a tawa before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a tawa or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional Indian platter with accompaniments.
Garnish with a side of sliced onions and lemon wedges.
